channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Sanergy Group shares rebound as firm blames ‚Äòforced sale‚Äô for 98% slump
item.description: The Hong Kong listed company saw its stock price slump 98% on Tuesday. Sanergy Group shares have now increased 78% after the Chinese company said a ‚Äòforced sale‚Äô had driven the plunge in its stock.

item.title: Nvidia down 2% in premarket trading after plunge that wiped out nearly $300 billion in market cap
item.description: Nvidia's huge rise in recent years has been directly related to its dominance in AI chips for data centers.

item.title: After Putin dodges arrest in Mongolia, the Kremlin says no one can hold Russia back
item.description: There was more than a whiff of self-satisfaction from the Kremlin on Wednesday, after Russian President Vladimir Putin wasn't arrested on his trip to Mongolia.

item.title: I give my mother‚Äôs ailing next-door neighbor $500 a month. She agreed to sell me her house, although she‚Äôll continue to live there. Is this a good plan?
item.description: ‚ÄúShe has a next-door neighbor who is 72 and disabled, and has even more serious problems.‚Äù

item.title: Nvidia plunges almost 10%, dragging basket of chip stocks to worst day since March 2020
item.description: Nvidia's steep drop Tuesday knocked almost $300 billion in market cap off the chipmaker and weighed on the broader market.

item.title: Volkswagen flags lower sales as labor unions protest potential plant closures
item.description: Management at German automotive giant Volkswagen is set to go toe-to-toe with workers on Wednesday as leaders are set to present details about possible cuts.

item.title: ‚ÄòWe live on Social Security‚Äô: We lost $2,000 in an IRA after 5 years ‚Äî so we fired our adviser. We put the money in CDs. Now what?
item.description: ‚ÄúThey put all our money in mutual funds and the only person making money was our broker.‚Äù

item.title: Elon Musk's Starlink says it will block X in Brazil to keep satellite internet active
item.description: SpaceX satellite internet service Starlink said it will comply with court orders to block social network X in Brazil.

item.title: Cathay Pacific confirms it expects A350s back in service within days after engine issue
item.description: The Hong Kong airline said 15 of the 48 Airbus A350s in its fleet were found to have engine fuel lines that required replacement.

item.title: Before the Fed lowers interest rates, make these 4 money moves to prepare your finances
item.description: With Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell saying ‚Äúthe time has come‚Äù for rate cuts, here‚Äôs how to handle credit-card debt, cash and big purchases.

item.title: House Democrats ask Trump for proof he did not take $10 million 'cash bribe' from Egypt
item.description: Reps. Jamie Raskin and Robert Garcia told Donald Trump they were looking into allegations that he took a "cash bribe" from Egypt's president.

item.title: Former Fed official says investors can get distracted by ‚Äòbouncing ball‚Äô of economic data
item.description: It‚Äôs been a difficult month for anyone trying to trade economic data releases. One policymaker says investors may be putting too much emphasis on them.

item.title: Former top aide to New York Gov. Hochul charged with acting as foreign agent for China
item.description: Linda Sun, who had been New York Gov. Kathy Hochul's deputy chief of staff, is accused of laundering millions of dollars received from China.

item.title: Nvidia $279 billion wipeout ‚Äî the biggest in U.S. history ‚Äî drags down global chip stocks
item.description: In the U.S., chipmaker Nvidia plunged more than 9% in regular trading, leading semiconductor stocks lower amid a sell-off on Wall Street.
